page.title: 04CHURCHES IN NORTH FERRIBY.
page.content: There are 2 churches in N.Ferriby, All Saints'Church_Anglican on Church Road and the Methodist Church on the High Street.The present church All Saints is the third one to be built upon this site.It was designed by John Loughborough Pearson and was completed in 1848.The church is in the Geometrical style of the later 13th C. and is 108ft.long overall.The octagonal broach spire is 165ft.high.A board records 64 names of incumbents over 7and a half centuries.The last rector being Rev.David Bulman,who died June 1985 after serving the parish for 21years.The Domesday Book entry for N. Ferriby tells us that in 1086"A Priest in there and a Church."In 1828 Primitive Methodists established a meeting house in Ferriby.This small building was used for 50 years and new premises were built in 1878.
